rule.name: Exported Type
rule.description: an exported type should have comment or be unexported More explain here:https://github.com/golang/lint/blob/master/lint.go#L761

rule.name: Form comment of exported type
rule.description: comment on exported type should be of the form \"Type...\"" More explain here: https://github.com/golang/lint/blob/master/lint.go#L761

rule.name: don't use ALL_CAPS in Go names; use CamelCase
rule.description: don't use ALL_CAPS in Go names; use CamelCase More explain here: https://github.com/golang/lint/blob/master/lint.go#L517 and https://golang.org/doc/effective_go.html

rule.name: don't use an underscore in package name
rule.description: don't use an underscore in package name More explain here: https://github.com/golang/lint/blob/master/lint.go#L517 and https://golang.org/doc/effective_go.html

rule.name: don't use leading k in Go names
rule.description: don't use leading k in Go names; kFoo or kfoo should be Foo or foo More explain here: https://github.com/golang/lint/blob/master/lint.go#L517 and https://golang.org/doc/effective_go.html

rule.name: don't use underscores in Go names
rule.description: don't use underscores in Go names More explain here: https://github.com/golang/lint/blob/master/lint.go#L517 and https://golang.org/doc/effective_go.html

rule.name: error should be the last type when returning multiple items
rule.description: error should be the last type when returning multiple items More explain here: https://github.com/golang/lint/blob/master/lint.go#L1263

rule.name: error strings should not be capitalized or end with punctuation or a newline
rule.description: error strings should not be capitalized or end with punctuation or a newline More explain here: https://github.com/golang/lint/blob/master/lint.go#L1169

rule.name: error var err should have name of the form errFoo
rule.description: error var err should have name of the form errFoo More explain here: https://github.com/golang/lint/blob/master/lint.go#L1115

rule.name: exported function returns unexported type
rule.description: exported function returns unexported type, which can be annoying to use More explain: https://github.com/golang/lint/blob/master/lint.go#L1287

rule.name: if block ends with a return statement, so drop this else and outdent its block
rule.description: if block ends with a return statement, so drop this else and outdent its block More explain here: https://github.com/golang/lint/blob/master/lint.go#L1007

rule.name: package comment
rule.description: package comment should be of the form \"NamePackage...\" More explain here: https://github.com/golang/lint/blob/master/lint.go#L352

rule.name: package not have leading space
rule.description: package comment should not have leading space More explain here: https://github.com/golang/lint/blob/master/lint.go#L352

rule.name: receiver name should be consistent
rule.description: receiver name %s should be consistent with previous receiver name %s for %s More explain here: https://github.com/golang/lint/blob/master/lint.go#L1202

rule.name: receiver name should be a reflection
rule.description: receiver name should be a reflection of its identity; don't use generic names such as \"this\" or \"self\"" More explain here: https://github.com/golang/lint/blob/master/lint.go#L1202

rule.name: receiver name should not be an underscore
rule.description: receiver name should not be an underscore More explain here: https://github.com/golang/lint/blob/master/lint.go#L1202

rule.name: drop assignment
rule.description: should drop assignment; it is the zero value More explain here: https://github.com/golang/lint/blob/master/lint.go#L929

rule.name: Should have a package comment
rule.description: should have a package comment, unless it's in another file for this package More explain here: https://github.com/golang/lint/blob/master/lint.go#L352

rule.name: should not use basic type
rule.description: should not use basic type (https://tour.golang.org/basics/11) as key in context.WithValue More explain here: https://github.com/golang/lint/blob/master/lint.go#L1400

rule.name: should not use dot imports
rule.description: should not use dot imports More explain here: https://github.com/golang/lint/blob/master/lint.go#L440

rule.name: should omit 2nd value from range
rule.description: should omit 2nd value from range; this loop is equivalent to `for %s %s range ...` More explain here: https://github.com/golang/lint/blob/master/lint.go#L1051

rule.name: should omit type %s from declaration of var %s
rule.description: should omit type %s from declaration of var %s; it will be inferred from the right-hand side More explain here: https://github.com/golang/lint/blob/master/lint.go#L929

rule.name: should replace
rule.description: should replace x=x+1(respectively x=x-1) with x++ (respectively x--) More explain here: https://github.com/golang/lint/blob/master/lint.go#L1235

rule.name: should replace Sprintf by Errorf
rule.description:
should replace %s(fmt.Sprintf(...)) with %s.Errorf(...)
More explain here: https://github.com/golang/lint/blob/master/lint.go#L1077

rule.name: Initialisms
rule.description: Words in names that are initialisms or acronyms (e.g. "URL" or "NATO") have a consistent case. For example, "URL" should appear as "URL" or "url" (as in "urlPony", or "URLPony"), never as "Url". Here's an example: ServeHTTP not ServeHttp. More explain here: https://github.com/golang/go/wiki/CodeReviewComments#initialisms

rule.name: Package names
rule.description: All references to names in your package will be done using the package name, so you can omit that name from the identifiers. More explain here: https://github.com/golang/go/wiki/CodeReviewComments#package-names and https://github.com/golang/lint/blob/master/lint.go#L887

rule.name: a non-main package has blank imports
rule.description: a blank import should be only in a main or test package, or have a comment justifying it More explain here: https://github.com/golang/lint/blob/master/lint.go#L408 and https://github.com/golang/go/wiki/CodeReviewComments#package-comments

rule.name: comment on exported type
rule.description: comment on exported type should be of the form \"Type ...\" (with optional leading article) More explain here: https://github.com/golang/lint/blob/master/lint.go#L761 and https://github.com/golang/go/wiki/CodeReviewComments#doc-comments

rule.name: context.Context should be the first argument
rule.description: context.Context should be the first parameter of a function More explain here: https://github.com/golang/lint/blob/master/lint.go#L1426 and https://golang.org/pkg/context/

rule.name: exported * should have comment
rule.description: exported %s %s should have comment or be unexported More explain here: https://github.com/golang/lint/blob/master/lint.go#L794

rule.name: exported * should have comment
rule.description: exported %s %s should have comment or be unexported More explain here: https://github.com/golang/lint/blob/master/lint.go#L834

rule.name: exported * should have its own declaration
rule.description: exported %s %s should have its own declaration More explain here: https://github.com/golang/lint/blob/master/lint.go#L834

rule.name: don't use unit-specific suffix
rule.description: var %s is of type %v; don't use unit-specific suffix %q More explain here:https://github.com/golang/lint/blob/master/lint.go#L1343
